question: On treating 100 mL of 0.1 M aqueous solution of the complex <katex>$CrCl_{3}.6H_{2}O$</katex> with excess of <katex>$AgNO_{3}$</katex>, 2.86 g of AgCl was obtained. The complex is: [cite: 178-180]
explanation: Moles of Complex = 0.1 M * 0.1 L = 0.01 mol. Moles of AgCl = 2.86 g / 143.5 g/mol = 0.02 mol. The ratio of AgCl to Complex is 2:1, meaning 2 Cl ions are outside the coordination sphere. Formula is <katex>$[Cr(H_{2}O)_{5}Cl]Cl_{2}.H_{2}O$</katex>. [cite: 182, 183]
